docs.title: QueryHound
docs.text:
A fast, simple CLI to analyze MongoDB JSON logs for slow queries, COLLSCANs, and more.

  • Source: https://github.com/dmcna005/queryhound_qh
  • PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/queryhound/

Use the left nav to explore installation, usage, and examples.

docs.title: 1) Slow queries only
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --slow

docs.title: 2) COLLSCANs only
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --scan

docs.title: 3) Namespace + minimum duration filter
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --namespace app.users --min-ms 50

docs.title: 4) Percentile stats + CSV export
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --pstats --output-csv report.csv

docs.title: 5) Filter raw lines by keywords (plus summary)
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --filter "index" "COLLSCAN"

docs.title: 6) Connection sources (Remote IP + App)
docs.text:
qh mongodb.log --connections

Verbose (no truncation):

qh mongodb.log --connections --verbose

docs.title: 7) Slow queries with full plan summaries
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --slow --verbose

docs.title: 8) Slow COLLSCAN queries with percentile stats
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --slow --scan --pstats

docs.title: 9) Slow queries within a date range
docs.text:
qh mongodb.log --slow --start-date 2025-09-10 --end-date 2025-09-12

With percentile stats + verbose:

qh mongodb.log --slow --start-date 2025-09-10T00:00:00 --end-date 2025-09-12T23:59:59 --pstats --verbose

docs.title: 10) Inspect only errors and fatals
docs.text:
qh mongodb.log --error

Show full messages:

qh mongodb.log --error --verbose

docs.title: 11) Focus on one percentile
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --slow --pvalue P90

docs.title: 12) Drill into a namespace and export
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --scan --namespace sales.orders --output-csv sales_collscan.csv

docs.title: 13) Combine filter & error mode
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --filter "ReplicaSetMonitor" --error

docs.title: 14) Top 10 distinct queries
docs.text:
qh mongodb.log --query

Show with full details (no truncation):

qh mongodb.log --query --verbose

docs.title: 15) Queries for specific namespace
docs.text: qh mongodb.log --query --namespace myapp.users

docs.title: Why doesn’t qh run right after install?
docs.text: Open a new terminal to pick up PATH changes. QueryHound also attempts a best-effort PATH update on first run.

docs.title: Does QueryHound modify my shell profile?
docs.text: If the user scripts dir isn’t on PATH, it appends an export line to ~/.zprofile (or falls back to ~/.zshrc). Opt-out with QUERYHOUND_SKIP_PATH_UPDATE=1.

docs.title: What log format is supported?
docs.text: MongoDB JSON structured logs.

docs.title: How is Query Shape determined?
docs.text: Priority: existing queryShapeHash / queryShapeId; else a derived concise signature from the command body or pipeline.

docs.title: Why are some fields truncated?
docs.text: To keep tables readable. Use --verbose to disable truncation.

docs.title: Will --output-csv include error or connection tables?
docs.text: No, it only exports the slow / scan summary table.

docs.title: How do I only see fatal issues?
docs.text: Use --error then filter the output (Fatal shows severity F).

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
pip install -U queryhound

If qh isn’t found after install, open a new terminal. QueryHound attempts to add your user scripts directory to PATH automatically on first run (opt‑out with QUERYHOUND_SKIP_PATH_UPDATE=1).

docs.title: Quick check
docs.text:
qh --version
qh --help

docs.title: First exploration
docs.text:
Show slow queries with extended stats:

qh mongo.log --slow --pstats

List connection sources:

qh mongo.log --connections

Show only errors / fatals:

qh mongo.log --error

docs.title: Version 0.7.3 (Latest)
docs.text: Release Date: December 23, 2025

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Stream Input Support (stdin): You can now pipe MongoDB JSON logs directly into QueryHound without specifying a file.
  • Accepts - as the logfile to read from standard input.
  • If no logfile is provided and data is piped, QueryHound automatically reads from stdin.
  • Works across all modes: --slow, --scan, --connections, --error, and --query.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Pipe a live stream and analyze slow queries
tail -f /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log | qh - --slow

# Pipe compressed logs to query analysis
zcat mongo.log.gz | qh --query

# Pipe systemd journal JSON logs and show only errors
journalctl -u mongod -o json | qh --error

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Special logfile - is always considered valid input.
  • When piping data, you can omit the logfile entirely (stdin is auto-detected).

docs.title: Version 0.7.2
docs.text: Release Date: September 24, 2025

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• Enhanced Query Analysis (--query/-q): Major improvements to query shape extraction
  • Now correctly filters for COMMAND entries only (c: "COMMAND")
  • Properly extracts query shapes from attr.command.aggregate and attr.command.find
  • Shows detailed filter field names (e.g., find:filter:status,age:sort:created)
  • Displays actual pipeline stages (e.g., aggregate:pipeline:[$match,$group,$sort])
  • Provides much more meaningful and actionable query analysis results

docs.title: Technical Improvements
docs.text:
• Added _extract_command_query_shape() function for proper MongoDB command parsing
  • Enhanced filtering to focus on aggregate and find operations specifically
  • Improved query shape representation with field-level details
  • Better pipeline stage extraction for aggregation queries

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Now shows detailed query shapes like:
# find:filter:status,age:sort:created
# aggregate:pipeline:[$match,$group,$sort]
queryhound --query /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log

docs.title: Version 0.7.1
docs.text: Release Date: September 24, 2025

docs.title: Bug Fixes
docs.text:
• Improved Error Handling: Fixed user experience issues with file-related errors
  • Replaced technical stack traces with user-friendly error messages
  • Added proper file validation for all processing modes
  • Enhanced error messages for file not found and permission denied cases
  • Improved overall tool reliability and user experience

docs.title: Technical Improvements
docs.text:
• Added _validate_logfile() helper function for consistent file validation
  • Wrapped all file operations in proper exception handling
  • Added graceful handling for interrupted operations (Ctrl+C)

docs.title: Version 0.7.0
docs.text: Release Date: September 24, 2025

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Query Analysis Mode (--query/-q): New mode to analyze the top 10 distinct queries in MongoDB logs
  • Shows query shape, execution count, and source information (app name or IP address)
  • Provides insights into the most frequently executed queries
  • Helps identify query patterns and their origins

docs.title: Enhancements
docs.text:
• Added comprehensive query shape extraction and aggregation
  • Improved source tracking to show application names or IP addresses
  • Enhanced tabular output formatting for query analysis results

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Analyze top queries
queryhound --query /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log

# Analyze queries within date range
queryhound --query /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log --start-date "2024-07-01" --end-date "2024-07-31"
• Add --error mode to list severity Error/Fatal (E/F) entries with truncated messages (use --verbose for full)

• Derive operation from attr.type when present
  • Add Query Shape column (uses queryShapeHash or derived from command object)
  • Truncation improvements for new column

• Add --connections mode aggregating connection events by remote IP and app name
  • Truncate long plan / app fields for --slow / --scan tables
  • Add --verbose flag to show full untruncated values

• Add -v/--version
  • Auto PATH update helper
• Packaging and CI improvements

docs.title: 0.1.x
docs.text: • Initial release

docs.title: Usage & CLI Options
docs.text:
QueryHound operates on MongoDB JSON structured logs.

qh [logfile | -] [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --scan — Only show COLLSCAN queries (plan & shape truncated by default)
  • --slow — Only show slow queries (ms >= 100) (plan & shape truncated by default)
  • --start-date <ISO> — Start date (ISO 8601 or YYYY-MM-DD)
  • --end-date <ISO> — End date (ISO 8601 or YYYY-MM-DD)
  • --namespace <db.collection> — Filter by namespace
  • --min-ms <int> — Minimum duration (ms)
  • --pstats — Include P75, P90, P99 stats
  • --pvalue <P50|P75|P90|P99> — Include a specific percentile
  • --output-csv <path> — Write output to CSV (slow / scan summary tables only)
  • --filter <str ...> — Show lines containing any provided strings (also prints matching raw lines)
  • --connections — Aggregate connection accepted events by Remote IP + App Name
  • --error — Show only Error / Fatal severity log lines (s in {E,F})
  • -q, --query — Show top 10 distinct queries with shape, count, and source
  • --verbose — Disable truncation (Plan / App Name / Query Shape / Error Message)
  • -v, --version — Show version and exit

docs.title: Stream Input (stdin)
docs.text:
QueryHound can read from standard input. This is useful for piping logs from other commands or live streams.

  • Use - as the logfile to explicitly read from stdin.
  • If no logfile is provided and data is piped, QueryHound automatically reads from stdin.
  • Works with all modes: --slow, --scan, --connections, --error, --query.

Examples:

# Analyze slow queries from a live stream
tail -f /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log | qh - --slow

# Query analysis on compressed logs
zcat mongo.log.gz | qh --query

# Show only errors from systemd journal JSON
journalctl -u mongod -o json | qh --error

docs.title: Truncation Behavior
docs.text: For readability, very long fields are truncated when using: --slow, --scan, --connections, or --error. Truncated fields: Plan, App Name, Query Shape, Error Message. Use --verbose to show full values.

docs.title: Percentiles
docs.text:
• When --pvalue is P50, the median (P50) column is added.
  • When --pstats is set, P75, P90, P99 columns are appended.

docs.title: Query Shape Column
docs.text:
Appears in slow / scan summaries. Resolution priority:

  1. Use queryShapeHash / queryShapeId if present.
  2. Else derive from the command object: main verb (find, aggregate, count …) + concise signature (e.g. filter keys or first pipeline stages).

Purpose: cluster similar logical operations without dumping full query bodies.

docs.title: Connections Mode
docs.text: --connections groups connection-accepted events by Remote IP + App Name. App name is extracted from any of: appName, applicationName, client.application.name.

docs.title: Error Mode
docs.text: --error filters lines whose severity field s is E (Error) or F (Fatal) and prints a table of: Timestamp, Severity, Component, ID, Message (truncated unless --verbose).

docs.title: Query Mode
docs.text:
--query shows the top 10 most frequently executed distinct queries. For each query it displays:

  • Query Shape: The query pattern (queryShapeHash if available, or derived signature)
  • Count: Number of times this query was executed
  • Sources: Application names or IP addresses that executed this query (up to 3 shown)

docs.title: CSV Output
docs.text: --output-csv exports only the tabular slow/scan summary (not raw filtered lines or connections/errors output).

docs.title: Combining Flags
docs.text:
Common combos:

qh mongo.log --slow --pstats
qh mongo.log --scan --pvalue P90
qh mongo.log --slow --namespace sales.orders --min-ms 250
qh mongo.log --slow --start-date 2025-09-15 --end-date 2025-09-16 --pvalue P50
qh mongo.log --error --verbose
qh mongo.log --query --namespace mydb.users
